TypeSignature.Value: .class public ansi sealed beforefieldinit EventDescriptor extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Contains the metadata that defines an event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class represents an event defined in the manifest. After writing your manifest, you use the Message Compiler (MC.exe) to generate a resource file. A byproduct of the process is a header file that contains the event descriptor in C, as shown in the following example.
``` EXTERN_C __declspec(selectany) const EVENT_DESCRIPTOR ReadEvent = {0x1, 0x0, 0x10, 0x4, 0x0, 0x0, 0x8000000000000005}; ```
Use the values of the descriptor to create an instance of this class, as shown in the following example. The keyword is an unsigned long value and cannot be cast directly to a long; you must use the `unchecked` language keyword to allow the assignment.
``` unchecked { readEvent = new EventDescriptor(0x1, 0x0, 0x10, 0x4, 0x0, 0x0, (long)0x8000000000000005); } ```
You use the descriptor when calling the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.WriteEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.WriteEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
For more information on writing the manifest and using the message compiler, see [Developing Event Publishers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa964766\(v=vs.85\).aspx)

MemberSignature.Value: public EventDescriptor (int id, byte version, byte channel, byte level, byte opcode, int task, long keywords);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 id, unsigned int8 version, unsigned int8 channel, unsigned int8 level, unsigned int8 opcode, int32 task, int64 keywords) cil managed

Docs.param: Version of the event. The version indicates a revision to the event definition. You can use this member and the Id member to identify a unique event.
Defines a potential target for the event.
Specifies the level of detail included in the event.
Operation being performed at the time the event is written.
Identifies a logical component of the application that is writing the event.
Bit mask that specifies the event category. The keyword can contain one or more provider-defined keywords, standard keywords, or both.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For details on these parameters, see the attributes of the [EventDefinitionType](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa382754\(v=vs.85\).aspx) complex type.

Docs.summary: Retrieves the channel value from the event descriptor.
Docs.value: The channel that defines a potential target for the event.

Docs.summary: Retrieves the event identifier value from the event descriptor.
Retrieves the keyword value from the event descriptor.
Docs.value: The keyword, which is a bit mask, that specifies the event category.

Docs.summary: Retrieves the level value from the event descriptor.
Docs.value: The level of detail included in the event.

Docs.summary: Retrieves the operation code value from the event descriptor.
Docs.value: The operation being performed at the time the event is written.

Docs.summary: Retrieves the task value from the event descriptor.
Docs.value: The task that identifies the logical component of the application that is writing the event.

Docs.summary: Retrieves the version value from the event descriptor.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The version indicates a revision to the event definition. You can use this member and the Id member to identify a unique event.
